title: Observation Skills for Caregiving
headline: This free online course equips you with the competent observation skills essential to providing responsible healthcare.
description: Does working as a caregiver for children interest you? You might want to consider honing your observational skills. In this course, you will gain proficiency and build skills to monitor and record changes in a person's health or social wellbeing and study childcare responsibilities. Discover clinical observation management processes and explore social policies and social work to expand your options for a career in social work.
courseDescription:
Are you a people person seeking a career helping others? Perhaps you love working with children and are already in social work. This course will increase your skill set, broadening your healthcare, caregiving and social work prospects. The course was designed to be informative and practical by industry experts at Johns Academy. You will become familiar with standard observation skills and responsibilities in diverse areas as we discuss the procedures for watching, listening and analysing the words and actions of children as they interact with people and their surroundings.

Next, we will explore child observation planning and documentation. Discover the different phases, plans and processes of handling a massive amount of data or information. With the practical sections contained in the course, you will gain precise knowledge of child observation methods and studies you may select to practice on a child. We also discuss social policy and social work observation to understand better social policies as a prerequisite to beginning social work practice.

Next, we explore basic health observation and learn basic test and condition assessments, including routine check-ups and diagnosis. Finally, we will delve into clinical management observation, which aims to help you build communication skills and move past the difficulties of management routines. This short course can help improve your health observation competencies in demand for child and patient care and social work. Start learning today!
